subject: Photography
title: Hue, Saturation, and Brightness
description: A micro-lesson that makes Hue, Saturation, and Brightness usable.

hook.text: Red, bright red, dark red, pale red. The same hue can feel completely different based on saturation and brightness.

buildup.text: Hue is the color name: red, blue, green. It's the base identity of every color you see.

discovery.text: Saturation is intensity. A vivid sunset is highly saturated. A foggy morning is desaturated.

twist.text: Brightness controls mood. Bright and saturated feels energetic. Dark and desaturated feels somber or dramatic.

climax.text: HSB â€” hue, saturation, brightness â€” is how cameras and editors organize color. Master it and you control mood.

punchline.text: Three sliders. Infinite moods. That's color.

quiz.question: What does saturation control in a photograph?
options: The intensity or vividness of a color
The specific hue of a color
